title: Quaker Font
content:
I need to know what kind of typography quaker uses the phrase in the site that say “sua vida com mais vida” in this site:

[http://www.quaker.com.br/home1.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025051729/http:/www.quaker.com.br/home1.html "http://www.quaker.com.br/home1.html")

 [‹ making a font out of some capitals](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025051729/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49569 "Go to previous forum topic") [British style typo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025051729/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49558 "Go to next forum topic")
author: douglas_rez

comments.content: What is the name of this font?

As no one else seems to be able to identify this font, my suggestion would be to go to [www.sudtipos.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025051729/http:/www.sudtipos.com/ "www.sudtipos.com") and try to find something close to this. Sudtipos is probably a good choice for this kind of font.

Alternatively, you could try [www.letterheadfonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025051729/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/ "www.letterheadfonts.com")

JH

you, I found a similar “malbeck”  
thanks
